name: Inn on the Alameda

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights at the Inn on the Alameda and found the location to be perfect for us in Santa Fe. It is located about a block away from the galleries on Canyon Road and a short walk to the Plaza. Close enough for convenience, but nice and quiet. We booked and stayed in a Deluxe King that was located on the lower level. There was a small patio with a wall dividing us from the parking lot, which was tall enough to give us privacy, but anyone walking by could certainly peer over if they wanted to. The room was spacious and had a kiva fireplace (gas). We really only used it once as the weather was not cool enough for us to get the full benefit of a fire. If I were to return I would not pay extra for a room with fireplace as I think it is more of a novelty. The Breakfast Buffet has lots of delicious options to choose from including hot items. You can sit inside or outside in the courtyard which is lovely. The exterior of the hotel is built with adobe elements and decorated with the typical ristras (dried bunches of red chiles) and there is a faint scent of pinon pine in the air. The inn also offers a complimentary happy hour with sangria, beer, iced coffee, etc and they do a really generous buffet of cheeses, olives, bread, crudites and other snacks. This was however the most expensive hotel we stayed in during our trip ($243 + tax a night) so all those extras are worked into the rate. If I returned to Santa Fe, I would probably stay here again and would definitely recommend it to others. The staff is very good and were very proactive about confirming our stay and sending us some information on the local area ahead of time.
reviews.title: Great Santa Fe Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: What a lovely place, with warm caring staff, and incredible proximity to everything Santa Fe! I can't even begin to describe how amazing our experience was there. Jose at the front desk was kind enough to help us get the most perfect room; Charlie was behind the bar at the afternoon wine/cheese reception and has the most amazing Sangria recipe (and great stories), Rachel at the front desk in the AM was gracious and warm, and we felt as if we'd found a new home. In the evening, both Jose and Charlie helped us with recommendations for dinner and other activities, and Jose moved heaven and earth to get us a room that we'll never forget. After just a couple of days there, we were sure we'd found new forever friends. In fact, Santa Fe has become our new "go-to" destination, just because of this place and its people. I recommend it most highly!!
reviews.title: A new forever favorite!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here six years ago and have come back to Santa Fe every year but tried other places in between. Not that we didn't like the Alameda but more that we like variety. We came back to stay at the Alameda last week and it was just as good as the first time. The location near Canyon Road and within a few minutes walk to the Plaza is great. What we really enjoy is the quiet, yet convenient location, private balcony, and (to be clear) the great free breakfast buffet (ask what all the eggy frittata things are), and free parking. Add it up, and the Inn on the Alameda is just a really nice and comfortable place to stay at a great value.
reviews.title: Always the Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I spent 2 nights here earlier this month with hiking with a small group. I had a Traditional Room with 2 queen beds. I found the hotel to be comfortable and quiet, and it is close to the historic Santa Fe Plaza and Canyon Road art galleries.
reviews.title: Nice hotel near the Santa Fe Plaza and Canyon Road art galleries

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is no restaurant per say; however, the hotel provides a nice nightly happy hour with beer, wine, cheese and veggies. Also included is a very nice breakfast buffet, which is much higher quality than the usual hotel buffet.
reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff, high end decor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our 4th stay in 7 years and once it again it was absolutely wonderful. The inn staff are always smiling, have great recomendations, and are helpful in everyway. We were upgraded to a king suite, so that was a very pleasant surprise. Our room was spotless and quiet, both very important to us. This is an older hotel, so the bathroom was not as large as new properties, and the showers not as fancy, but it was comfortable for 2 people and had plenty of storage for toiletries.
reviews.title: Outstanding, again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfast was a continental breakfast with 2 choices of a hot dish each morning, a frittata or a stuffed croisant. We had both and they were good. Lots of pastries to choose from, some we liked , some we didn't, but plenty of choices and variety, so if you can't find one you like, then you're just too picky. Granola was great, and additionally, fresh fruit, juices, coffees, lattes, etc, plus bagels, and other breads, so you won't go hungry.
reviews.title: AT LAST A PLACE SPENDING ON CUSTOMERS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Happy hour is always a highlight, the best Sangria ever. Charlie the bartender is wonderful, and always remembers you and your drink of choice. A nice selection of complimentary wines/beer to choose from and cheese, breads, and other appetizers as well.
reviews.title: The Inn on the Alameda will always be our first choice of accommodations in Santa Fe.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010
reviews.text: We asked the concierge to make our dinner reservations for all 4 nights, all were done , our tables were great and their restaurant recommendations outstanding.
reviews.title: Exactly What I was Looking for...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: All in all a perfect stay.
reviews.title: Love this place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I couldn't imagine a nicer, more friendly, more wonderful place than Inn on the Alameda. Every detail of this inn was a highlight and there's no room or time to get into each and every one. Suffice to say that `wine hour' is a must. Great way to meet people, relax ... and the bartender, Charlie, will make you feel at home. The best advice: Try this place and you won't look anywhere else again.
reviews.title: Stay Here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our family stayed in a 2 Queen Casita for 4 nights during the end of March.
reviews.title: Cozy,Cozy,Cozy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We felt very comfortable in the casita due to its cleanliness and space. An empty fridge is always a bonus and the included breakfast buffet was very good. For us, the location was the best, only a short walk into the center of town. The only thing that kept me from giving a 5 star rating was the age of our suite. There were a few things that showed their age...the toilet that sounded like we had a fish tank in the room, you had to jiggle with the handle to place the stopper in the right position to make it stop (Annoying at night). The socket of the lamp would fall out when you turned it on or off, it would light up though, you just had to be careful. Two other things in the washroom could use a little fix up as well. Apparently the Inn has a newer section that you might want to ask for. The entire staff that we encountered were excellent! When in Santa Fe, don't miss Cafe Pasquals for supper.
reviews.title: Other reviews on the mark: excellent value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Other reviews are accurate. Walk another 3-5 minutes from center of town and save. Small hotel excellent in all aspects:including a fine breakfast and free wine/snacks at cocktail hour.
reviews.title: Cozy boutique hideaway features privacy, great staff, yummy extras

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located adjacent to Canyon Road, which is lined with endless art galleries, and very near to the Plaza and all its shopping, museums, and restaurants, Inn on the Alameda is easy to find but also a hidden treasure. The hotel is a collection of several intimate adobe buildings (1-2 stories only), and we stayed in one with 8 "standard" rooms, but with plenty of luxuries within. Each room is so cozy, clean-smelling, and decorated with plush features like clay tiles and skylight in the bathroom, intricate southwest wooden ceilings, Pendleton coverlets over densely woven cotton-covered down comforters that don't overheat in the middle of the night, and the beds were pure heaven. Luxe toiletries, heavy cotton robe for chilly mornings, and every exterior wall of the place is photogenic - and this was at the end of winter when the flowers are not even blooming yet! Every morning features a complementary breakfast (7-11 a.m.) buffet - large variety of fresh pastries, various quiches, fresh fruit, muesli/granola & other cereals, cottage cheese, toast/bagels, variations like smoked salmon one day and knishes another, fresh juice & coffees, hot water & big variety of teas. Plus the option of upgrading to lattes, etc., for extra fee. Seating areas are not crowded, and the public rooms are intimate spaces with beautiful southwest decor. Every afternoon from 4 to 5 worn-out shoppers return for the rite of wine & cheese, which again has generous helpings of various wines and sangria, a nice variety of cheeses, sliced bread, crackers, olives & fruit. AND the front desk has a concierge on duty to give advice and directions to everywhere you can think to go. There's even a refrigerator by the free-internet computer laden with fresh sandwiches and cold drinks. Everyone is helpful and willing to converse if you like but respects your privacy when you want to be left alone. The overall atmosphere is quiet, friendly, just cozy and comfortable. I noticed other hotels bigger and perhaps fancier, but I wouldn't even think of staying anywhere else but Inn on the Alameda when I return.
reviews.title: outstanding small hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was convenient to Canyon Rd. art galleries, as well as the downtown Plaza---but the hotel is on a very busy corner, so traffic noise was bothersome, including big trucks, & sirens from emergency vehicles. The rooms & the grounds could use more attention to housekeeping & detail. The windows in our room were very dirty ---looked like they had not been cleaned in a long time. We felt that the price ---over $300 for a mini-suite, was overpriced for the accommodations. Also, rooms are dimly lit with flourescent light bulbs. I requested brighter bulbs, but they did not have any, so I went out & bought some myself.
reviews.title: beware of traffic noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were upgraded to a suite which was large and tucked away on a busy street. The slight traffic noise was muted behind the walls and greenery. Excellent breakfast, pleasant helpful staff.
reviews.title: Relaxing in Bustling Santa Fe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel was good. Not great, but not bad and the location was close to the plaza. It did seem a little over priced as it isn't right on the plaza and looks like it hasn't been renovated in a while. Staff was great and the room was clean.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: spent 5 days at the Inn on the Alameda and had a wonderful time. The hotel is located perfectly for walking trips thru Santa Fe. The staff is pleasant and eager to assist with directions and recommendations. Breakfast is more than just a "buffet". The food is plentiful, fresh and very tasty. Their coffee - both regular and decaf - is very good. The rooms are adequate and comfortable. We would definitely stay there again and can highly recommend it. Visit Ojo Caliente if you can - it was superb!!
reviews.title: As good as it gets

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been going to Santa Fe for 23 years and we have tried many hotels over the years. When we finally got around to trying the Inn on the Alameda, we were hooked. Aside from the perfect location, the Inn is well managed, clean, comfortable and quiet. There's a great buffet breakfast, as well as afternoon wine and cheese included in the room rate. Most of the staff has been there over the years, which means you get good service and employees are treated well. Clientele seems to be more adult than most places, which means you don't get a lot of screaming babies and kids rampaging through the parking lot early in the morning. Room features vary; the traditional rooms are not quite as nice as the newer rooms. The suites at the back of the Inn are absolutely perfect and mercifully quiet.
reviews.title: Most Perfect Place in Santa Fe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is perfect for a visit to Santa Fe.
reviews.title: Absolute Delight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: It has LOCATION: walk to Canyon Rd, walk to center plaza and to all restaurants. It is quiet but yet with the amenities one needs. It has no restaurant but yet is close to all Santa Fe restaurants and then one can have a lovely stroll home in moonlight to this quiet adobe hotel
reviews.title: Pretty Place
Perfect location
reviews.text: 24 hour coffee is available, many rooms have balconies to view sunrise , moonlight and flowers.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Efficient housekeeping with plenty of ice available. No minibar however
reviews.title: Confortable, convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is included and really is extremely good: with a good buffet, with great fresh fruit, delicious frittata and fresh fresh croissants ( I watched each morning as they were delivered). How pleasant to sit outside in the quiet courtyard to breakfast, when back East was suffering high temps and humidity.
reviews.title: Quiet, Clean, Comfortable, and Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I stayed at the Inn during Martin Luther King Jr. weekend with some girlfriends. It is a wonderful hotel/B&B! It is centrally located-within walking distance to most stuff in town, especially the art galleries, which are across the street. The staff are very friendly and helpful with restaurant recommendations--especially Duane! They serve a very scrumptous breakfast, with tons of variety. On the weekends they add a nice meat or fish...we had an incredible chipotle encrusted salmon! The rooms are cozy and well appointed. In the afternoon, they serve wine and cheese for guests in their cozy living room off the lobby. This is a great value for the price!
reviews.title: A Great B&B--I would stay there again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed 4 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Inn. Well maintained facility that has a cozy and warm atmosphere. Breakfast is healthy and scrumptious. 5 minute walk to the plaza where there is lots of shopping and restaurants. If we travel to Santa Fe again we will definitely stay here.
reviews.title: Highly recommend!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Inn on the Alameda for five nights as part of our first trip to New Mexico (see separate trip report). We had a lovely room with our own little courtyard, fireplace in the bedroom and living room. Although this particular room was a little dated (only apparent when looking at the bathroom fixtures - brass!), it was immaculate and perfectly decorated. We New Englanders were looking for full southwest immersion and we were not disappointed!
reviews.title: Cozy, comfortable romantic retreat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Inn has a bed and breakfast feel to it, particularly for people like us who stayed several days. We were particularly impressed with the service and the friendliness of the employees. Both the bartender (our friend Charlie) and the people at the front desk graciously gave their time to help in the selection of restaurants and driving routes to the various destinations in our itinerary. The nightly wine and cheese hour was a lovely way to end a day of touring and start planning the next day's adventures.
reviews.title: A Great Getaway in the Heart of the Southwest
Great Hotel
reviews.text: Looking to find some constructive criticism, my husband found the breakfast offerings lacking variety by the end of our stay. With so many to chose from, we were very pleased with our choice of accomodations in Sante Fe and would highly recommend the Inn on the Alameda.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent hotel, great location, step to downtown. Our room was nice and comfortable . Good free breakfast in the morning. Wine and chees upon your arrival. Free parking. Only negative point: does not have an elevator and our room was on the second floor.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, would go back.
Arrogant, rude and unwelcoming
reviews.text: Approaching Sante Fe, my husband and I stopped at the Information Center right outside of town to get information about lodging. We found a brochure for an place called the Inn on the Alameda which looked inviting and comfortable, so we checked the availability and rates on the computer at the Information Center. It listed numerous available rooms and we saw a room with a king size bed listed for $91.00 with a AAA card, which we have. Since we were 10 to 15 minutes away we decided not to book it online, but to drive straight to the hotel. At the front desk I explained to the young woman at the front desk that we had just been to the Information Center and saw a room with a king size bed listed as available and giving a 10% discount with a AAA card. She said, "Yes, and because you are here I can offer you a 20% discount with your card. The rate will be $180.00". I explained that it was listed as $91 online and she said she did not see that. She then said the most inexpensive room she could offer us was a third floor room that had no elevator. I told her it wasn't a matter of price, but of principle. My husband asked if she had Internet access and she told us it was in the adjoining room. When we searched their site we were not able to view the available rooms as the computer did not have the lastest version of Adobe Flashplayer, and it was necessary to be an "administrator" to download it. We went to the front desk again, and were told the property manager had stepped off the property so it could not be done. We told her we would wait. While we waited a few feet away in the lobby, I heard her call the manager and explain the situation. After the phone call she never approached us to tell us what was said, and let us remain sitting. We realized we had our iTouch on us, and were able to view the rates on their web site and then showed them to the receptionist. She told us she could not offer us that price, it was an online price. I asked her if she actually wanted to inconvenience us to the extend we would have to leave and find a computer so that we could book it online, although we were standing right in front of her. We were told that is what we would have to do to get that rate. At that point, we not longer wished to stay and went to a Hampton Inn, where were treated with friendly, courteous service and given a great, clean and comfortable room for $89. If you decide you want to stay here, better book online before arriving!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A planned one night stay at the inn turned into a four night stay to due to the excellent hospitality, comfortable room, lavish breakfasts, and optimal location for accessing downtown Santa Fe. My husband and I felt truly at home in our little casita with a private patio and elegant yet comfortable ambience.
reviews.title: A great place to stay and relax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk staff were extremely helpful and attentive. The fireplace in the lobby was a welcoming and warm place to sit and read or chat. The afternoon wine and appetizers were delicious and the breakfast which is described as a continental breakfast is anything but...as it included fruit, cereal, frittatas, quiche, pastries, yogurt, ham, hard boiled eggs, toast, bagels, juice, coffee all served by courteous and positive staff.
reviews.title: A charming inn in a good location...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our stay in Santa Fe was definitely enhanced by our stay at the Inn on the Alameda.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I traveled to Santa Fe for New Year's Eve and found the Inn on the Alameda through Trip Advisor. It was just fabulous! Granted $200 a night is pricey, but it included free parking & an amazing breakfast. It was so nice to not have to worry about finding breakfast in the morning or extra charges for parking on our final bill.
reviews.title: Great food, location, & atmosphere!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location was great, one block from Canyon Rd., and a nice 1/2 mile walk to the Plaza. Some people called this Inn a B&B, but it is isn't all. B&Bs are usually smaller, quainter, w/ few guests. This place is a small hotel with great atmosphere, beautiful fireplaces, and nice employees.
reviews.title: These nfolks do it right!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I loved it, and look forward to going back.
reviews.title: Fabulous B&B to stay when in Santa Fe!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Granted this place is a splurge for us, but it is worth it. We've been to Santa Fe 10 times and to the Inn 3 times. Decor, service, comfort, location,...what more could we ask? A great breakfast and happy hour are both included. And the last visit we received an upgrade on our room.
reviews.title: Wonderful, helpful people and charming rooms!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just spent a week at the Inn on the Alameda and couldn't have picked a better place. Friends recommended it and it was awesome. Walking distance from Plaza, easy access, and our casita was a very nice suite to stay in. Afternoon wine hour was always good and we met other travelers. Dining recommendations were always good and staff was outstanding in service.
reviews.title: Best place in town for the money

description: Nestled in the heart of Santa Fe, New Mexico, between the historic Plaza and the art-filled galleries of Canyon Road, the Inn on the Alameda is the ideal downtown Santa Fe lodging location. With this cozy inn as your home base, you can explore our town’s unique attractions, unique museums, fine dining, distinctive boutiques and local festivities. An ample continental breakfast with organic. vegan and gluten-free selections is included with every stay, as is a relaxing afternoon wine hour daily. Wi-fi and parking are always free, and one pet under 30# is welcome with a nightly fee in pet-specific rooms.
